availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lemuel B. Bruce (Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer and laborer)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer and laborer. Tennessee native. Son of Alfred Bruce and Hannah Bruce. Married to Mary A. Vickery in Henry County, Tennessee, on January 7, 1853. Father of William A. Brice, Isaac W. Bruce, Hannah E. Bruce, Thomas A. Bruce, Mary E. Bruce, and Susan Bruce. Farmer in Madison County, Tennessee, in 1850. Laborer in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Hickman County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Madison County, District 5, p. 272B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 481.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 437B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hickman County, KY, June 1863, p. 2.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Henry County, 1898-1929: Marriages 4-5, p. 54.
